name: Naturæ Fractalis One: Gorka Valencia
description:
With this work I want to pay tribute to Gorka Valencia, the most important person in my photography journey. He did not teach me anything about photography technique or about composition, rule of thirds or exposure triangle, he taught me to trust my vision and sensitivity, even when I was completely lacking photography skills. That’s why I call him mentor.

“Aarón, you have a great sensitivity, keep doing photography, the world needs your vision.” 
Sadly, Gorka committed suicide about five years ago. When that happened, I got to know that he put their first camera in the hands of many people. He was a cheerful person and had a life we could call “successful”. But even with all that, he could never overcome the pain coming from the feeling that his parents never loved him. 

Much of the beauty and evolutive positivity that I transmit with my photography, is only possible because Gorka trusted me. If you are reading this, I want to tell you “Please, trust yourself, we need your vision”. 💚


Fractal from original photography. Please zoom-in the image to explore the details on the intersection 🙏

10000 x 6623 px / 300dpi / 40.8 MB
